meta.scene_intent: Uncommon quality well-crafted steel sword with green gem. A noticeable step up from vendor trash — this is the first blade a player would feel good about equipping. The green gem in the pommel and faint emerald glow signal 'uncommon' immediately. The steel is polished, the craftsmanship deliberate. Still grounded and believable, but clearly superior to common iron.

subjects.element: Steel longsword with green gem — uncommon quality
subjects.details: A well-crafted steel longsword approximately 95cm in total length, visibly superior to common ironwork. The blade is straight, double-edged, made of polished steel with a mirror-like sheen along its fuller and visible grain pattern in the metal suggesting careful folding during forging. The blade edge is keen and unblemished — no nicks, no pitting — with a bright specular line running its full length. A single shallow decorative groove parallels the fuller on each flat of the blade. The crossguard is slightly upcurved at the tips, forged from the same quality steel but with brass wire inlay in a simple knotwork pattern along its length — a mark of a smith who takes pride in work. The grip is wrapped in dark oiled leather, tightly and evenly wound with brass wire cross-wrapping at quarter intervals for improved purchase. The pommel is a faceted steel octagon housing a single oval-cut green gemstone (emerald or peridot) approximately 12mm across, set in a brass bezel. The gem emits a faint, steady green luminescence (#1eff00) — not magical fireworks, but a subtle inner glow suggesting the stone holds a minor enchantment. This glow is the primary visual indicator of uncommon quality.
subjects.scale: Weapon fills approximately 80% of the square frame, oriented diagonally from lower-left to upper-right at roughly 30-40 degrees from vertical

camera.shot_type: Flat icon view with slight 3/4 angle — standard WoW inventory icon perspective
camera.angle: Very slight 3/4 rotation (approximately 10-15 degrees from perfectly flat) to give minimal depth to the crossguard curves and pommel gem facets while keeping the blade in clear profile
camera.lens_equivalent: Orthographic / flat projection — no perspective distortion, consistent with game UI icon conventions
camera.focal_point: The green gemstone in the pommel — the brightest point in the composition and the immediate quality-tier signifier
camera.depth_of_field: Infinite — everything in perfect focus, UI icon convention
composition_rules: Weapon centered in frame, filling approximately 80% of the square canvas
Diagonal orientation lower-left to upper-right (blade tip upper-right, pommel lower-left) — standard WoW weapon icon layout
Green gem positioned in the lower-left quadrant where it anchors the composition and draws the eye
Dark gradient background: darkest at center, slightly lighter at edges
Single weapon only — no secondary objects, no hands, no environmental context

lighting.key_light: Soft directional light from upper-left at 45 degrees, cool white (6000K), creating a strong polished-steel reflection along the blade's left edge and a clean highlight across the crossguard brass inlay
lighting.fill_light: Dim ambient fill from below-right, slightly warm (#9a9a8a), lifting the shadows on the grip and pommel underside just enough to reveal the leather wrapping detail
accent_lights: Green gem internal glow — the emerald/peridot emits a soft steady #1eff00 luminescence that casts a faint green wash on the lower portion of the grip and the brass pommel setting, creating a small pool of colored light
Bright specular edge-catch along the full length of the blade — a crisp line of #d4dce4 silver-white, much brighter than the common sword, indicating superior polish
Faint uncommon-quality green glow (#1eff00 at 20-25% opacity) as a subtle backlight halo around the entire weapon silhouette
lighting.shadows: Soft drop shadow beneath the weapon blending into the dark gradient. The green gem glow creates a very faint green tint in the shadow area directly below the pommel. No hard cast shadows.
atmospheric_fx: Dark gradient background: radial gradient from #1a1a1a at center to #0d0d0d at corners, with a very faint green tint (#0a1a0a) bleeding in from the pommel gem direction
Faint green luminous mist around the pommel gem — not particles, just a soft diffused glow halo extending 5-8mm from the stone surface
Subtle painterly grain texture throughout the background to maintain hand-painted feel
Green border glow (#1eff00 at 20-25% opacity) around the weapon's silhouette edge — the uncommon quality aura indicator
